definition: bad/spoiled/broken/to break down/(suffix) to the utmost

sentences.english: If you’re a burglar, tell me how to keep bad guys out of my house.
sentences.chinese: 如果你是一個盜賊，告訴我怎樣讓壞蛋遠離我的家。

sentences.english: Ceartainly is a worst old bad egg.
Now then for it, wicked little one.
sentences.chinese: 那麼你說吧，你這個小壞蛋。

sentences.english: She defeated the bad guy by virtue of her courage and by a pair of vices.
sentences.chinese: 由於她的勇氣和藉助一對老虎鉗，她打敗了那個壞蛋。

sentences.english: I'd advise you not to associate with him, he's a bad lot.
sentences.chinese: 我奉勸你不要和他交往，他是一個壞蛋。

sentences.english: The baddies have far more interaction with the environment too.
sentences.chinese: 壞蛋們將和環境產生更強的互動。

sentences.english: Here dwells the villain of English children's stories—the red fox.
sentences.chinese: 英國兒童讀物中出現的大壞蛋紅狐狸就住在這裏。

sentences.english: There has to be some bad eggs in there.
sentences.chinese: 已有有一些壞蛋在其中了。

sentences.english: The bbg heard that God had come to his neck of the woods and went to meet with Him.
sentences.chinese: 那個大壞蛋聽說到神已來到他那塊就去見他。

sentences.english: Hollywood turned them into superheroes and supervillains.
sentences.chinese: 好萊塢把他們變成了超級英雄和超級大壞蛋。

sentences.english: I think it's safe to say it's the bad Vlad.
sentences.chinese: 我只是覺得說壞蛋弗拉德的話保險一點。

sentences.english: Presently they dragged two poor wretches from the boats.
sentences.chinese: 目前他們的船拖着兩個貧困壞蛋。

sentences.english: That motherfucker hurt my little sister!
sentences.chinese: 那個大壞蛋傷了我的小妹。

sentences.english: You may be generally attracted to bastards but that will not get you anywhere except hurt.
sentences.chinese: 你一般很容易被壞蛋吸引但是他們只會讓你受傷。

sentences.english: Dinnae ye want her help fightin' the baddies?
sentences.chinese: 你不想讓她幫你揍那幫壞蛋？
那個壞蛋昨天受到了教訓。

definition: to follow bad examples/to be corrupted by bad examples
lit. I dare not (accept the honor); fig. I don't deserve your praise/you flatter me
to keep on saying (idiom); to repeat over and over again
to make a mess/to mess with/to be wild/to sleep around/to jump into bed
to tell the truth/to tell it as it is
to do what one is told/obedient
in the right and self-confident (idiom); bold and confident with justice on one's side/to have the courage of one's convictions/just and forceful
to watch with amusement as sb makes a fool of himself
